Description: Model of a piriform or ‘pear-shaped’ mace-head made of unfired Nile clay.
Curator's comments: Published: E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, 'Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna' (London, 1911), 21, 33, pl. xx.3 lower left corner. This object originally had a wooden handle, and may have been painted, although no trace of pigment survives. A real stone mace of the same shape was found in the same tomb (EA 49004).
